meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be assimilated.
meanings.sent1: Her assimilabilities made it easy for her to learn new languages.
meanings.sent2: The assimilabilities of different cultures enrich our society.
meanings.sent3: His assimilabilities were so impressive that he could even mimic accents for fun.
meanings.sent4: The assimilabilities of the team members blended seamlessly, creating a harmonious work environment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher praised the student's assimilabilities in understanding complex concepts.

meanings.definition: The ability to be absorbed or integrated into a group or culture.
meanings.sent1: The assimilabilities of the new employee helped them quickly adapt to the company's culture.
meanings.sent2: Cultural assimilabilities play a crucial role in fostering unity within a community.
meanings.sent3: The assimilabilities of the shy student into the drama club surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her assimilabilities were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly into the group dynamic.
meanings.sent5: The assimilabilities of the traditions into the modern society highlighted the importance of heritage.
